revised_title: The Prolonged Effect of Veratrine on Heat Production in Medullated Nerve
tldr: The author investigates the effect of veratrine on the heat production of medullated nerve. They find that veratrine causes a prolonged production of heat in response to a single shock, with the total amount of heat being much greater than in a normal nerve. The study also shows that the efficiency of recovery varies under different conditions, and that complete asphyxia and recovery can enhance the veratrine effect.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Nerve Physiology
